alert.note: Alert for Ozark; Stone; Taney; Texas; Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 18 at 11:13AM CDT until March 19 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Christian, Douglas, Ozark, Stone, Taney, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1111 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in areas that already received rain early this morning. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Bryant Creek at County Road 223, Bull Creek at Center Road, Little North Fork River at County Road 916, Beaver Creek at County Road 524 and Pond Fork at County Road 883. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Mountain Grove, Ava, Forsyth, Hollister, Rogersville, Cabool and Seymour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Ozark; Stone; Taney; Texas; Webster; Wright
